comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content:
Great to see everyone scrutinising our catalogue descriptions!  

The text within quotation marks replicates exactly the full text of Beato's handwritten notes on each photograph. They are the sum total of the information that we have on each image and their spelling reflects Beato's and prevailing norms in the 19th century. They are part of the document in the same way as details in the photograph and it would be wrong to change them.

That said, this does create problems with searching which is why I (and other users) have tagged the images with modern spellings (Sikh, Suakin not Suakim as Beato has it) to make finding these items easier.
